qas.question: Who did Freddie Mercury collaborate with in 1988?
When did Queen release The Miracle?
Which Queen album had more shared writing credits?

context: After working on various solo projects during 1988 (including Mercury's collaboration with <a0_0>Montserrat Caballé, Barcelona<a0_0/>), the band released The Miracle in <a1_0>1989<a1_0/>. The album continued the direction of A Kind of Magic, using a pop-rock sound mixed with a few heavy numbers. It spawned the European hits "I Want It All", "Breakthru", "The Invisible Man", "Scandal", and "The Miracle". The Miracle also began a change in direction of Queen's songwriting philosophy. Since the band's beginning, nearly all songs had been written by and credited to a single member, with other members adding minimally. With <a2_0>The Miracle<a2_0/>, the band's songwriting became more collaborative, and they vowed to credit the final product only to Queen as a group.
